Тяжело писать обзор на эту игру по той причини что ты или не можешь подобрать слова которые могли бы передать те чувства что она тебе принесла, или же начав писать про неё ты не сможешь остановиться поскольку слишком многое хочешь сказать. Она имеет восхитительный сюжет, который тебе дарит бурю эмоций, главные персонажи вызывают приятные чувства и ты за них и в правду переживаешь. Тебе становиться их жалка в тех моментах где это надо, и радость там где они шутят. В неё обязательно нужно поиграть каждому кто хочет познакомиться с игрой в которой есть один из лучших сюжетов и при этом является шутером с интересной механикой. И желательно покупать её с ДЛС чтобы полностью наплодиться всей серией)

Я прошел игру.И могу сказать что в плане геймплея игра довольно однообразна.Радуют только способности которые появляются временами,но и тех большая часть безполезна(я использовал только Charge).Но концовка меняет все кардинально.Когда закончилася игра,я сидел с открытым ртом еще час.В общем игра на 3 из 5.Но сюжет,особенно концовка, 5 из 5.По этому если вы любитель неожиданих поворотов то игру стоит пройти раз побыстрому.

Prettiest game I've ever played.  Unfortunately, the gameplay just isn't up to the same standard as the visuals.
The combat system gives you a fair selection of powers and guns to use, but there's a massive disparity in their usefulness.  You end up only wanting to use about 2-3 of the powers, and then there's the guns.  You're only able to carry two at a time, and out of the dozen or more guns that are available, there are a few very good ones, a couple of decent ones, and the rest are crap.  You end up using the best ones until you run out of ammo, then have to deal with the shitty ones until until you find more ammo for the good ones.

TL;DR: They should have made it a movie.

ホラー要素が苦手なので初代Bioshockは積んであるのだが、これはそこまででもなさそうだったのでプレイ。
細かいところでは不満に思う部分もあったが、それを全て帳消しにして流してしまうぐらい素晴らしいゲームだった。
個人的には今までプレイしたシングルプレーFPSで5本の指に入るぐらいの傑作。メタスコア94は伊達じゃない。

独特の世界観、魅力的なキャラクター(特にヒロインが凄い!ディズニー映画ばりに動いてプレイヤーを助ける)、爽快感のある戦闘、引き込まれるプロット、優秀な翻訳・吹き替え。
プレイヤーは渋いオッサン(野原ひろしボイス)となり「借金を帳消しにするため(Wipe away the debt)」に空中都市に乗り込み、不思議な少女と出会い、運命に翻弄されながら全ての核心に迫っていく。
ストーリーにはちょっと難解な部分もあって混乱するので、主人公と一緒に時々記憶を整理しながらプレイするのがオススメ。
ネタバレになるので詳しくは書かないが、最後に全てが明かされたときは呆然とした。ちょっと泣いた。

This is probably the best game in the world. That's not to say everyone will love it. I think almost everyone can gain something from playing this game. It is first and foremost an excellent shooter game. I'm no legend in FPS games, in fact I pretty much suck. I played it at default difficulty and the game provided a consistent challenge, but never felt impossible. The learning curve might be a tiny bit steep for players new to Bioshock or FPSs. However the game does an excellent job of introducing you to these gameplay elements, without drawing you out of the environment. And oh, what an environment it is.

The game is about a year and 6 months old now, and the version I played during Turkey Weekend 2014 was remarkably stable. There were maybe two or three minor visual bugs, and one instance where I had to reload a checkpoint to continue. That's literally it for errors, everything else was flawlessly executed. Graphically, a quad-core processor and budget video card will let you set the quality to max visuals. I recommend this, because it's an important part of playing the game. Really, do play this game on PC, at max settings. You do yourself a disservice otherwise.

To say it is art is to damn it with faint praise.

Bioshock Infinite is beautiful. It's like a painting in motion; a world of wonder brought to life in vivid color and ethereal light. The city of Columbia is brimming with breathtaking imagery, particularly during the first half of the game. Shafts of soft light fall on pools of water that ripple in realistic fashion; water that casts reflections on nearby surfaces. Anyone who has been to an indoor pool knows this visual phenomena. There are moments where I had to stop and just admire how gorgeous everything was. In that respect it's unlike any game I've ever played.

These sumtuous visuals are complemented with excellent sound engineering and a terrific music score. The careful listener will much enjoy some clever musical arrangements. Everything is voice-acted, and that too has been done with care. The voice actors for the protagonist, Booker DeWitt, and his companion Elizabeth, are excellent. Troy Baker, Booker's voice actor, did a particularly fine job of fitting his voice to the era. There is frequent dialogue between Booker and Elizabeth; these conversations provide a level of intimacy that is all too frequently absent from games with a narrative.

In short I can't recommend this game enough. It's like a book you can immerse yourself in. Provides a solid 15-20 hours of play. It's actually worth $50, but if you can get it on sale, do. This review can't do it justice. You have to experience it.
biocock infinite

I cannot simply explain how awesome this game is. Playing it is simply not playing a video game, it is experiencing what booker is going through and the game makes good work of that. It immerses you into the world of colombia and what you think is a happy and wonderful place, turns out not to be.

You are put in the ongoing "war" between the ever "High-Class" citizens part of the Founders and the working class people of the Vox populi. 

My personal favourite area is Battleship Bay and although you literally spend like 5 minutes in the area and there are no enemies there (with the exception of the ticketing area), it is a really good example of a lively game, a place where there are so many things happening. The atmosphere is simply wonderful

Do you recommend this game?

Hell yeah I do

I really enjoyed this game, it has a fantastic story, lovely artwork, and a deep, engaging setting. Gameplaywise I feel that it really wasn't as interesting as Boshock 1 or 2. The skylines are nice and add depth, instead of the tonic system you have 4 clothing pieces that give you various attributes, there's no hacking system (there's a plasmid, but it's not the same). Still a fantastic game in a fantastic series.

p.s. for the love of god and all that is holy play the first game if you're thinking about getting burial at sea

Pues... vaya

Continuación de Bioshock, sin duda uno de mis juegos favoritos. Esta vez en vez de plantearse los videojuegos en sí, la moral humana o la codicia, comenta el peligro de los extremismos (tanto el religioso como el anarquista), la teoría de los multiversos o la diferencia enorme de clases. Primero la jugabilidad:

Arregla muchos fallos del Bioshock original: el poder tener un arma por un lado y los vigorizantes por otro, quitar el sistema de pirateo... pero hay otras muchas cosas que se han quitado: llevar las 8 armas en vez de 2, sustituir armas originales (arpón, lanzador químico etc.) por armas clásicas (que tengan un toque antiguo no es cambiar las armas), aunque diré que los plásmidos, o vigorizantes, me gustan más en este juego: muy originales. Pero lo que me fastidia es el cambio de sigilo y terror a acción plana: el juego está plagado de acción innecesaria: hordas ridículas de enemigos (¡porque merecen morir como auténticos soldados!), lluvia de misiles, enemigos por todos lados... cierto que este juego con sigilo no pinta nada, pero en el original el sigilo me permitía poder explorarlo todo con más tranquilidad (que eso es lo que te invita a hacer el juego) pero si tengo 5000 enemigos disparándome, pues lo siento, pero no puedo parame en los detallitos.

Y ahora la trama (¡sin spoilers!): sinceramente, merece un aplauso: después de siempre ver triples A de historias vacías, de personajes huecos y que se preocupaba más por que matara a x personaje antes de que me preocupara algo por la historia, esta saga le ha dado una patada a esa teoría: o te enteras algo de la historia o no avanzas. Y, por si fuera poco, narrativa visual, voxáfonos y detalllitos que te informan sin decir nada de pequeñas partes de la historia, o te pueden hasta decir mucho más. Y jooooder, esta historia SÍ merece la pena (no como COD AW, porque tengas a Kevin Spacey no tienes una buena historia) ¿Lo malo? El final. Si el final del original trastocaba, éste te deja muerto; y a no ser que o juegues 5 ó 6 veces más al juego o mires una explicación del final te vas a quedar con el culo torcido. Parece que lo hayan hecho más para marear que no para otra cosa.

Resumen: mejora cosas del anterior, pero falla en otras. Aunque nada es perfecto. Este juego merece mucho la pena, y es el claro ejemplo que los videojugos pueden ser más que "matar marcianitos" y llegan a contarnos historias increíbles.

Another smart game. The story, characters and world constructed drew me into a plot filled with twists and turns and constant moral grays. The ending was a little confusing and I didn't really like the fact that my choices earlier in the game didn't seem to have more of an effect, but I was able to over look that.

Not only that but the game play was also fun. I enjoyed using the new vapours and zipping around on the sky line. I would have prefered a more open world so I could use the sky line more and I would have also liked to have held on to more than one gun. But this didn't affect my enjoyment of the game.

To conclude a definite recomendation, and now I am going back for more with the DLC.

Bioshock Infinite keeps to the Bioshock formula, both in gameplay and storytelling. But both the gunplay and the presentation have been refined to the point of near perfection. This 10-hour or so campaign features incredibly fun combat, made even better with the skyhook, which allows you to sail through the sky and get the drop on enemies. In addition, the graphics are beautiful every step of the way, and the story pacing is flawless. The plot itself is amazing in every capacity, and the companion elizabeth is so well-fleshed out she feels almost like a living person. I do not have a single negative thing to say about this game, It is worth every dollar.

+beautiful visuals
+engaging and perfectly executed story
+great gunplay complemented by unique mechanics
this game is amazing, it got me hooked right off the bat

★★★★★ - "Do not miss this game" 

PROS:
- It has an intelligent narrative, memorable characters and varied enemies
- Above everything though is the gameplay, which is fast, fluid and adventurous
- Infinite is a vivid experience which will live long in the memory, for its unique and beautiful setting
- Easy to go back to for the fun had with its exciting combination of Vigors and shooting mechanics
- Best in the trilogy

CONS:
- DLC holds its price well

VERDICT?
Never a dull moment in Columbia.

Though it's not for everyone, I personally found Bioshock Infinite to be one of the greatest games ever made, and high up on my personal favorites list. I have never felt more invested in any other character than Elizabeth. The storyline is impeccable, and the gameplay is wonderfully hectic fun. 10/10 from me. It and its expansions are worth your money.

I really liked System Shock 2, Bioshock I and to a lesser extent: Bioshock 2. In order of Amazing to less impressive. Those games were so much more fun to play, in spite of the less advanced graphics.

Поиграв во много шутеров и просто разных игр с глубоким сюжетом , я видел многое. Но такой шедевр как bioshok infinite я наблюдаю впервые. Его сюжет захватывает до глубины души и порожает своей многогранностью , харизматичностью главных героев  и атмосферой начала 20-го века. Ради того что бы лучше понять сюжет я даже прошел первые 2 части и  DLC обновления . Задумка достойна не только фильма , но и я думаю даже книги . Биошок моя оценка тебе 10/10 .
P.S. надеюсь разработчики порадуют нас еще чем нибудь , хотя судя по  всему сюжет пришел к своей окнчательной развязке .

Game is very good. You can complete the entire thing on hard in ~10 hours on you first runthrough, but that's not a negative thing. The game is so well thought out and packaged that the entire 10 hours is engaging and incredibly fun. I know the standard in games is to have longer gameplay, but the balance between length and quality this one achieves is great.
wonderfully done!!!

I was really excited about this game, after having played System Shock 2, and both Bioshock games. Sadly this game feels as if gameplay wise it is trying to compete with generic shooters (quick time deaths, generic groups of bad guys at certain areas, without purpose).

That said the plot and characters are all excellent, and it has one of the best endings I've ever seen in a computer game, so despite the generic feeling gameplay it is still a highly recommendable game!

Bioshock Infinite est le troisième opus de la série. Nous quittons Rapture pour Columbia. Les principes de bases sont identiques: Des armes, des pouvoirs, une fille et son protecteur. Ce n'est pas rapture, mais nous ne sommes pas perdus. Des nouveautés: les failles, l'aéro-tram et Elisabeth. Cette fille qui vous suivra et aidera tout au long de l'histoire.

Les graphismes sont vraiment bon, mais Elisabeth avec sa grosse tête m'a gaché un peu le plaisir tout du long. Le gameplay est dynamique, les ennemis variés, mais nous sommes dans un couloir. Nous n'avons plus de choix dans l'histoire: être gentil ou méchant. Le scénario tente de vous faires croire que vous avez le choix, mais le moment venu, il n'y a qu'une seule chose à faire; appuyer sur "E". J'ai trouvé cela frustrant.

Je le recommande pour ceux qui souhaite se faire la saga Bioshock dans son intégralité, mais j'ai encore du mal à voir toutes les critiques sur-élogieuses qu'a recu ce jeu. Pour moi il est bon, mais ce n'est pas le jeu de l'année 2013.

Игра хороша!
Если вам подавай сюжет с интригой - то эта игра для вас!
Атмосфера игры выдержана полностью от музыки до корсета на вашей любимой девушке, поверте, за время игры она у вас появится!
Начало немного туговато и однообразно может показаться, но не отчаивайтесь, игра разойдется уже меньше, чем через 2 геймплейных часа, саму игру прошел за 13 часов.
Куча ящиков и сундуков испортило мое впечатления от гемплея, но они нужны для атомсферы, в конце концов, чтобы не портить геймплей никто не заставляет вас их обыскивать все, как сделал это я, чтобы набить ачивочку. Кстати, можете не особо пытаться её набивать, сундуков вам на всю игру хватит.
Для полного счастья и погружения в игру, советую сразу найти в интернете 8 комбинаций энергетиков и использовать их. Использование энергетиков - эта фишка с перовой части, за нее и полюбили биошок. Так что используйте их как можно больше и чаще.
В итоге - игра заслуживает своих оценок, и чтобы полностью окунуться в нее, придется напрячься самому, читая диалоги и используя энергетики.

"Alright, I'm probably going to go back and re-write a review for this at the moment this is what I got. One of the best if not THE best plots in any game ever, amazingly fun gameplay, beatiful sights, and a story that really makes you think. A MUST BUY!"

It really took me 3 years to re-write this review. I must have had some free time in there somewhere. I know I did. Ah well. I don't feel like reviewing this game now. Another time.

3 years and 6 months later I indeed have the time. Disregard what I said above in terms of the best plot and gameplay and stuff, I was young and stupid. I'm just not deleting it because I kinda like seeing what young me thought of games. This game doesn't suck and isn't a masterpiece. It's a good game. It gets a bit reptitive in terms of gameplay, and there's no real variation from mission type, every mission is just get from point A to point B. That's probably the most dissapointing thing about this game, because if you read the developers notes on what this game was originally intended to be, it was an open world almost RPG? It was kind of weird and wouldn't have really fit into a genre, they were hoping for it to define it. But alas, the budget shook its mean old head no, and this is what we got. And again what we got isn't bad, the voice acting is great (Troy Baker being superb as always), the graphics are great, the powers are interesting enough; though not the quality of the powers in a kind of similar game Dishonored or Dishonored 2. The plot has a shit ton of plot holes. If you take a couple minutes to actually analyze the end of the game, it makes no sense. There are also a couple things along the way that when you go back and replay it and think about it, it makes no sense for it to be this way aside from forshadowing. The idea was better then the execution. I will give it credit for making a game about killing crazy racists that doesn't feel one sided in it's view (I mean you're obviously killing the racist slave owners but the game itself presents it as a situation and doesn't really take sides), and it also does it without being pretentious. With a game like this that talks a lot about what really defines racism, and what is the idea of God and how it fits into our world, it somehow didn't come across as trying too hard or being pretentious like most games. I actually give them a lot of credit for that, as it's difficult to do. There are multiple decisions along the way of the game, but again these were just bits and pieces of the game that never was, the bizzare almost RPG game, so as a result we have like 3 kind of trivial choices throughout the game that in the grand scheme of things don't really matter. I'd say the 2 strongest things this game has going for it is the voice acting, and the setting, which is beautiful. I'm not quite sure why this was a Bioshock game though, as it doesn't deal with Rapture at all. I'm aware of the DLC in this game, of which I'm not fond, but for some reason this is technically the third of the Bioshock series? Why not just make it a stand alone new game? It probably would have sold better as I've heard quite a few people didn't want to get it because they thought the complicated plot tied back to those games, which it sort of did in the DLC, but really didn't have to. Anyway this game is like an 8/10. But as I said, I want to keep the original review I gave this game before I myslelf became a pretenious reviewer.
Шикарная игра, не пожалел о покупке.

The main game is awesome! both in PC port terms (engine, graphics, sound, technical stuff) and in the wonderful story ! The two DLC pieces are so and so, the second is better than the first but the second kindof needs the first to complete the story. The game is worth whatever price it will have but the DLC does not worth more than 5-7 usd..

Это шедевр! Эта игра произвела на меня такие впечатления, что невозможно их передать словами! Неожиданная концовка,   интересный интригующий сюжет. Перед уходом Irrational Games показали, какими должны быть игры. Геймплей, графика и сюжет на высоком уровне! Рекомендую игру всем, кто не играл, да и тем кто играл рекомендую её перепройти!

8.7/10

İlk başlarda belki sıkılabilirsiniz oyunu sevmeyebilirsiniz ama biraz daha ilerlediğinizde oyunun gerçek yüzünü o zaman göreceksiniz. Gerek hikayesiyle, gerek oynanışla, gerek karakterleriyle övgüyü kesinlikle hakediyor. FPS severlerin mutlaka oynaması gereken bir başyapıt. Hazır indirimdeyken almanızı şiddetle tavsiye ederim. Columbia'ya aşık olacaksınız..

Очень чувственная игра. Очень сочувствуешь героям и переживаешь за них, они все такие... живые что ли.
Дизайн самой игры конечно шикарен, все эти летающие здания - очень красиво. Игровая механика правильная для шутеров. Все удобно. Сюжет конечно, как говорится, без поллитра не разберешься. Все равно пришлось потом лезть на Википедию и перечитывать сюжет, так как после прохождения игры сидишь с несколько глупым видом от таких быстрых смен событий. Графика не сказал бы, что суперская, но за счет дизайна, все углы скрашиваются.
На мой взгляд, если поиграл в игру и в течение недели тебе что-то из нее вспоминается, то это хороший знак!

I went into this game not thinking of much. I have only heard things about it. But it was nothing compared to what actually experiencing this game really was. You can easily get lost into this game. 

Pros.
+ good combat
+ Elizabeth is the best follower who actually helps you in battle without getting in the way 
+ you get to shoot lighting from your freaking hands!
+ smooth 
+ good story 
+ fight a meca George Washington with a minigun

Cons 
- back tracking
- Checkpoints feel far apart 


Overall this game is a must play for all players who enjoyed the bioshock series 9.5/10
literally my favourite game of all time. a must buy
